author: hwright
msg: Require the sqlite3 module for running the python testsuite.
This most likely breaks the windows buildbot, as it does not currently have
Import sqlite3 at the top level.
(test_list): Don't make running tests conditional on the existence of the
sqlite3 module (since we're now guaranteed to have it).
Attempt to import sqlite3, and if we can't, die a horrible death.
(With a friendly error message, of course.)

author: julianfoad
msg: Remove the svnsync-obliterate branch: It's going nowhere.

author: rhuijben
msg: Add accept_deleted boolean on directory baton as a replacement for the
global hashtable collecting deletion roots. This removes all scratch
allocations used by just looking in the hash.
(do_entry_deletion): Update prototype, use normal argument ordering.
(check_tree_conflict): Use accept_deleted instead of checking the
(delete_entry): Pass accept deleted from parent baton.
(add_file): Read accept deleted from parent baton.
(open_file): Use accept deleted instead of hash.

author: hwright
msg: Move the temp-dir finding code from adm_files to wc_db.  The difference,
though, is that we now use the pdh to find the temp file location, which means
that when we centralize metadata, all the temp-files get centralized at the
same time.  It also adds the benefit of not worrying whether or not the
wri_abspath is a directory or file when looking for the temp location.
(open_reject_tmp_stream): Update caller, and add a few required params.

author: rhuijben
msg: "Two different strings, referring to the same entity, simply cannot *both*
This change makes svn_dirent_is_canonical() return FALSE on Windows
Technically this is a bug fix, but it might have impact on clients that
use svn_path_*() functions on Windows, where they really should use the
(svn_dirent_is_canonical): Declare lower case drive letters and paths with
a ':' anywhere but in the drive letter not-canonical.
